questions.question: He spoke ………………………..
questions.description: We use the adverb loudly to modify the verb spoke.

questions.question: I felt ……………………..
questions.description: Feel is a copular verb. We use adjectives, not adverbs, to modify copular verbs.

questions.question: She speaks …………………….. English.
questions.description: Here the adjective fluent modifies the noun English.

questions.question: They hit the stone ……………………..
questions.description: Hard can be an adjective or an adverb.

questions.question: Don’t drive too ……………………….
questions.description: The adjective and adverb form of fast is fast.

questions.question: I was hit …………………………. on the nose.
It serves him …………………………
questions.description: After a verb right is used to mean correctly.

questions.question: She is ……………………….. waiting for a call from her son.
The baby is sleeping …………………………
questions.description: Here soundly modifies the verb sleeping.

questions.question: He was ………………………… asleep.
questions.description: Sound is used as an adverb in expressions like sound asleep. In other cases, we use soundly.
